entries.title: Micron 9400 High-Performance Enterprise SSD And Biwin Public Offering
entries.description: Micron introduced its 9400 high performance enterprise and cloud PCIe Gen4 NVMe SSD for database, AI and multi-tenant environments.  Chinese flash and memory products company Biwin raises $86M US in public offering.

entries.title: A Psychologist Describes What Withdrawing From A Relationship Looks Like
entries.description: Here’s how you can tell if your partner is slowly inching away.

entries.title: The 2023 Enterprise Storage Agenda
entries.description: Senior Analyst, Storage & Data, Steve McDowell, dives in as it isn't easy to distill everything that's happening around the storage industry into a set of concrete predictions. In fact, it'd be folly to try. Steve McDowell offers up the topics that will set the storage agenda for the coming year.

entries.title: Ailing, Leaderless Jaguar Land Rover Has Options, But None Look Tempting
entries.description: Jaguar Land Rover is losing money and needs bigger sales and a big electrification budget to compete against BMW and  Mercedes. Neither is very likely, so the quicker it picks a partner or succumbs to a takeover, the sooner it can breathe easy.

entries.title: These Eco 5-Star Hotels Prove That Greenwashing Doesn’t Have To Be The Standard
entries.description: Here are some of the luxury hotels around the world which are going the extra mile to be green (many still have some ways to go).

entries.title: Steeped In Purpose: How A Coffee And Tea Company Is Forging A New Kind Of Social Entrepreneurship
entries.description: A conversation with Adam Thatcher, co-founder and CEO of Grace Farms, a Certified B Corp and the only premium tea and coffee brand that is not-for-profit owned and gives back 100% of profits to ending forced labor worldwide. Adam shares his insights on this innovative social enterprise structure.

entries.title: All The XR At CES 2023
entries.description: Major XR trends revealed.

entries.title: Good Health? We Owe It To Our Underfunded Public Health Infrastructure
entries.description: Dr. Anand Parekh, chief medical advisor of the Bipartisan Policy Center, explains why rooting for public health means rooting for America.

entries.title: 16 Ways Tech Leaders Can Help Their Teams Overcome A ‘Holiday Hangover’
entries.description: When coming back to work from an extended break, it can be difficult to get back into the groove and refocus on tackling the upcoming year’s challenges.

entries.title: Seoul Calls On Public To Vote On New Brand Slogan
entries.description: The Seoul Metropolitan Government (SMG) is kicking off the New Year by developing a new brand slogan to embrace the city’s exciting future.

entries.title: ‘Willow’ Has Some Of The Worst Costumes In The History Of Fantasy Television
entries.description: From denim jackets with zippers to printed T-shirts and rubber boots, Willow's costumes are just about as bad as they come.

entries.description: M3GAN is a fun, often very funny, horror movie that's a little too bloodless.

entries.title: Electronic Medical Records – Love Or Hate Them, Just Be Mindful
entries.description: EMRs are terrific tools. They must be utilized with care to ensure "clinical noise" is managed.

entries.title: Used Car Prices Post Biggest Drop On Record—And Have 'Much Further To Fall'
entries.description: "New and used car prices likely will decline through most of 2023," says one economist.

entries.description: 2023 will bring new challenges and new opportunities for security practitioners.

entries.title: The FDA Approved The New Anti-Alzheimer’s Drug Leqembi. What You Need To Know
entries.description: A trial found the drug slowed the progression of early-stage Alzheimer’s Disease.

entries.title: Digital Operationalization: The Key To Self-Sustaining ESG Performance Excellence
entries.description: ESG programs must accommodate diverse external and internal stakeholder expectations. And they must be capable of driving continuous progress toward stakeholder-agreed targets.

entries.title: NASA Confirms One Of Its Dead Satellites Just Fell Back To Earth
entries.description: NASA’s Earth Radiation Budget Satellite (ERBS) is no more after almost four decades in orbit.

entries.title: ‘The Boys’ And Amazon Make Fun Of HBO Max For Deleting Its Content
entries.description: I’m all for a good social media beef between megacorporations, and this time, Amazon is waging comedy war through a proxy…megacorporation, Vought International, the evil conglomerate from The Boys.

entries.title: Supply Chain Optimization: An Introduction
entries.description: Supply chain optimization is a key component for any business aiming to develop or maintain a competitive supply chain strategy, enabling retailers to uncover inefficiencies in their supply chain and develop better inventory policies that align with their business goals.

entries.title: Bankrate.com Report Predicts Fed Interest Rate Actions Likely To Send More Car Shoppers To Sidelines
entries.description: Car shoppers on a budget can’t catch a break. Actions by the Fed raising interest rates are causing new pain for some consumers financing purchases of new or used vehicles according to a Bankrate.com report.

entries.title: The Three Tier 1 ‘Marvel Snap’ Decks For January’s Zabu Savage Land Season
entries.description: I have been waiting to see what Marvel Snap Zone produced as its top Tier 1 decks for this month after the release of Zabu, and it turns out, an old favorite is still on top, and Zabu himself only makes the cut in one of the three top decks.

entries.title: How To Get Ahead Of The Scam Economy: Employers Are The Missing Link
entries.description: In today’s digital age, getting scammed online is more common than ever. It is so common, in fact, that an entire economy has flourished around it, built with fraudulent transactions, hacked accounts and stolen passwords.

entries.title: $36 Million Oxford Ionics Funding To Jump-Start Quantum Computing In 2023

entries.title: How Long Destiny 2’s Chainmail Iron Banner Grind Took Me, And If It Was Worth It
entries.description: Late last night I finished what I thought was going to be an insurmountable objective, grinding out nearly two full levels of Iron Banner ranks in order to secure a hyper-limited time shader in Destiny 2. One of the best I’ve seen from the game.

entries.title: Where To Start With The New ‘Sell Zack Snyder’s Justice League To Netflix’ Movement?
entries.description: When the history books of the internet are written, there should be an entire chapter devoted to the fanbase of Zack Snyder’s Justice League and the “Snyderverse.” It’s a group that is more passionate about the superhero universe than fans of any other piece of media I’ve ever seen,

entries.title: Top Self-Driving Car Stories Of 2022 In Review - Big Ups, Big Downs
entries.description: We wrap up the year with the biggest stories in robocars, from the very bad to the very good, of which 2022 had lots of both.  Includes video of the stories.

entries.title: Four Ways Marketers Can Work Smarter, Not Harder In 2023
entries.description: Simple tweaks can often make as big of a difference as a complete program overhaul.

entries.title: What Netflix Just Did To ‘Inside Job’ Season 2 Is Brutal
entries.description: While Netflix cancelling a show is not exactly breaking news at this point, this week we have a unique case with Inside Job, and its newly aflame mob of angry fans.

entries.title: Australian Open: Players Can Compete Even If They Have Covid—A Year After Government Deported Unvaccinated Djokovic
entries.description: Athletes competing in the Grand Slam will not need to test and can play even if they test positive, tournament director Craig Tiley said, a stark departure from last year’s policy.

entries.title: 2023 Will Be A Year Of Transition And Strategy For Businesses Worldwide
entries.description: 2023 will be a year of massive transition and a year of level-setting.

entries.title: AI Adaptations That Cope With Dodgy Generative AI ChatGPT Pitfalls, Showcased Via Some Emerging AI LegalTech That Answers Law Questions
entries.description: Generative AI such as ChatGPT have some disconcerting limitations, for which we take a look at those weaknesses and consider potential solutions. You can expect to see a lot of work on these problems in the months ahead.

entries.title: ChatGPT Is Coming To A Customer Service Chatbot Near You
entries.description: Meta, Canva, and Shopify among other companies are already using the technology that undergirds ChatGPT in their customer service chatbots, but experts warn that companies should be wary of generative AI’s creativity and unpredictability.

entries.title: Marvel Phase 5 Release Schedule: Every MCU Movie And TV Show Releasing In 2023 And Beyond
entries.description: It’s a brand new year and the next phase of the Marvel Cinematic Universe is about to kick-off.

entries.title: Why Do We Avoid Certain Opportunities, Even With Nothing To Lose?
entries.description: People are hesitant to take opportunities that have a low chance of success, even when they have nothing to lose. This tendency holds us back from pursuing opportunities that could yield great rewards. A simple mindset shift can help us be more objective, potentially yielding a lifetime of benefits.

entries.title: Does Your Digital Transformation Need An OTA?
entries.description: We all start digital transformations with high hopes. We intend to exceed the designated key performance indicators (KPI's) and quickly surpass our return on investment (ROI) goals.

entries.title: Do Telomeres Reveal Our True Age? And Can We Fix Them?
entries.description: Companies can measure your telomere length, which they suggest will tell your true, biological age. Is there any reason to worry about the health of your telomeres?

entries.title: How Cybersecurity Leaders Can Build Employee Trust—And Why It Is Important
entries.description: Leadership teams must work hard to convince employees that partnering with them is worth their time and effort.

entries.title: Rite Aid CEO Donigan To Leave The Drugstore Chain
entries.description: Rite Aid said its chief executive officer Heyward Donigan is leaving the company, which has struggled to become profitable in her three-year reign.

entries.title: Three Tips To Customize And Unlock The True Potential Of Maps For Businesses
entries.description: Expectations from maps vary widely, so companies should understand the basics before integrating custom technologies into existing map stacks.

entries.title: 2023: More ESG Rage Or A Kinder And Gentler Approach?
entries.description: Recently, The New York Times referred to 2022 as the Year of Rage. On the same day, The Times ran another story that highlighted BlackRock's pitch for socially conscious investing as antagonizing all sides of the debate. Let's hope that 2023 will see a kinder and gentler approach by all concerned.

entries.title: Audio-Technica’s New Flagship True Wireless Earbuds Are Simply Superb
entries.description: The new Audio-Technica ATH-TWX9 are a superb pair fo true wireless earbuds. They aren't cheap but they do have just about every feature you could want from a pair of earbuds. They sound pretty good too.

entries.title: Five Steps For CEOs To Weather Tough Economic Times
entries.description: Whether you company is strong or weak, here are a few things for CEOs to address when facing a tough economic outlook.

entries.title: Brings Arts Weltall-Id Toy Review: ‘Xenogears’ Fans Should Rejoice, As This Figure Is Entirely Amazing
entries.description: For those of us that played the original 'Xenogears' back in 1998, we never thought that we would see modern and proper toys made of the game’s mecha. Least of all the majestic Weltall-Id. Except that’s what has happened and the results are thoroughly impressive.

entries.title: The Payment Industry’s Virtuous Cycle Of Innovation: How New Tech Impacts Business Opportunities
entries.description: The payments industry’s virtuous cycle of innovation has created new technologies and raised consumer expectations, ushering in new eras of payments technology.

entries.description: By using tools to proactively measure and manage their own stress levels through quantitatively proven technology, people can recognize the harbingers of productivity decline before it occurs.

entries.title: How Cybersecurity Companies Can Become Trusted Partners
entries.description: In the cybersecurity business, leaders often muddle their core promises to customers with a relentless pursuit of complex features and underlying capabilities.

entries.title: Car Still King Reveals Prince Harry’s Right Royal Parking Spat
entries.description: Car parking spaces can pit neighbor against neighbour, and it seems the problem even afflicts the British Royal family.

entries.title: Ship Refloated After Getting Stuck In Suez Canal—The Latest Incident Hitting World’s Trade Artery
entries.description: The MV Glory, reportedly carrying grain from Ukraine, suffered a “sudden technical failure,” according to canal officials.

entries.title: 3 Shocking Healthcare Statistics For 2023
entries.description: As the New Year begins, a trio of healthcare statistics cast an intense and unflattering light on a nation in crisis. These figures set the stage for a financial reckoning in 2023 and beyond.

entries.title: 5 Life-Changing Tech Innovations That Most People Don’t Understand Yet
entries.description: Tech innovations such as artificial intelligence (AI), quantum computing, the metaverse, web3, and 5G are surrounded by so much hype and spin-doctoring that it can be difficult to get to the crux of things. Here, we try to cut through the hype.

entries.title: Can Drones And Artificial Intelligence Keep Us Safe From Sharks?
entries.description: Australian surf lifesavers are increasingly using drones to spot sharks at the beach before they get too close for comfort. Can AI help them with identifying dangerous species?

entries.description: A randomized and controlled study found that participants who exercise regularly and ate almonds daily for a month saw significant benefits from incorporating the legumes into their diets.
